medical_history.chief_complaint: Dysphagia and vomiting after some meals.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 2 months before presentation, the patient noted discomfort in his throat described as a 'golf ball.' Pantoprazole was administered for gastroesophageal reflux disease but did not improve his condition. Six weeks later, he had chronic nocturnal heartburn, sensation of food sitting in his upper chest, decreased oral intake, and intermittent vomiting. He reported weight loss of 9 kg over the previous 2 months. There was some symptomatic improvement after esophageal dilation performed 2 days prior to the oncology clinic visit.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, degenerative disk disease, diarrhea related to a partial small-bowel resection at age 11, transient ischemic attack, dental extractions, spinal laminectomies, and knee arthroplasty.
medical_history.family_history: The father died from heart disease at 45 years of age, and the mother died from metastatic cancer (unknown primary) at 85 years of age; no family history of gastrointestinal diseases was noted.
medical_history.social_history: The patient smoked cigarettes (45 pack-years), drank alcohol in moderation, did not use illicit drugs, and lived with his wife, daughter, and grandchildren.
